author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...ERIN CONTINUES GENERALLY WESTWARD... ...EXPECTED TO BECOME A HURRICANE IN A COUPLE OF DAYS...
summary: ...ERIN CONTINUES GENERALLY WESTWARD... ...EXPECTED TO BECOME A HURRICANE IN A COUPLE OF DAYS... As of 11:00 AM AST Wed Aug 13 the center of Erin was located near 16.3, -43.4 with movement W at 17 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1004 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...ERIN CONTINUES GENERALLY WESTWARD... ...EXPECTED TO BECOME A HURRICANE IN A COUPLE OF DAYS... As of 11:00 AM AST Wed Aug 13 the center of Erin was located near 16.3, -43.4 with movement W at 17 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1004 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Storm Erin (AT5/AL052025)
